image.altText: A man in a black suit and tie speaks at a press conference.

items.synopsis: WA Deputy Premier Roger Cook will be the state’s next premier, after Health Minister Amber-Jade Sanderson confirms she has withdrawn from the leadership contest.

title.children: Roger Cook to become WA's new premier after all other contenders pull out of race

image.altText: An elderly lady holds up two faded photos of a small, smiling boy.

items.synopsis: It's been almost 50 years since Jimmy Taylor vanished from outside a shop in his home town. Now a new suspect and a $1 million reward have sparked hopes the mystery may be solved.

title.children: A missing boy, a mystery man and a town full of secrets: Why the clock is ticking to find Jimmy Taylor

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

items.synopsis: For the past decade, student debts have increased by about 2 per cent a year on average, but tomorrow they will rise by a massive 7.1 per cent. The consequences of increased debt will affect graduates for decades.

title.children: Indexation of student debts to have lifelong impacts on Australians' borrowing capacity

image.altText: Former Hawthorn senior management Chris Fagan, Alastair Clarkson and Jason Burt.

items.synopsis: An independent panel investigating allegations of racism at the Hawthorn Football Club concludes, making no adverse findings against former senior coaches and managers.

title.children: AFL shuts down Hawthorn racism review as First Nations players seek to 'resolve all differences'

image.altText: Graphic showing the merging of a human head and electronic circuits

items.synopsis: Top artificial intelligence executives join experts and professors in raising the "risk of extinction from AI", urging politicians to equate it with risks posed by pandemics and nuclear war.

title.children: Tech world warns risk of extinction from AI should be a global priority

image.altText: Antarctica hits new low sea ice extent

items.synopsis: Antarctica's sea ice is now reforming as the continent moves deeper into the austral winter, but it's currently the smallest it has ever been for this time of year on record. This blip in the Antarctic pulse is the latest in a string of record lows that is being watched carefully by scientists.

title.children: Satellite data reveals chilling blip in Antarctica's sea ice, this is what it looks like from space

image.altText: Ice on a path with trees

items.synopsis: More than 100 Australian weather stations have just registered their coldest May minimum temperatures on record. And the cold snap had Sydney experiencing some of its iciest May nights in 66 years.

title.children: Australia shivers through one of its coldest Mays

image.altText: A worker abseils against a building to inspect drone damage.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says the biggest-ever drone strike on Moscow targeted civilians, accusing Ukraine of an attack that would warrant a "severe" response.

title.children: Russia warns Ukraine of harsh response after 'terrorist' drone strike on Moscow

image.altText: A woman with a black blazer holders a book while standing in a garden.

items.synopsis: South Korea hoped that a 69-hour working week would encourage more women to have children and solve the country's ageing population problem, but women say the real barrier is embedded in the culture.

title.children: South Korea wants women to have more babies, but their latest idea outraged millennials and Gen Z

image.altText: A composite of three images

items.synopsis: With almost half of Australians having a parent born overseas, multicultural Australians' vote in the Voice referendum could prove significant. It's a cohort both the Yes and No campaigns are trying to court with community forums.

title.children: 'We can no longer be ignored': Why the Yes and No campaigns are courting multicultural votes ahead of the Voice referendum

image.altText: A man in a dark navy suit and pink tie speaks in parliament, with an Indigenous female minister sitting behind, watching on

items.synopsis: The new Australian Centre for Evaluation will be tasked with examining whether government programs work — before they are rolled out. Imagine how much good it could do if it's allowed to, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Will Albanese live up to his own promises to end pork-barrelling? There is a sliver of hope

image.altText: Kosovo tensions

items.synopsis: NATO will deploy more forces to northern Kosovo after 30 of its peacekeepers were injured in clashes with ethnic Serb protesters.

title.children: NATO to send 700 more troops to Kosovo to help quell violent protests

image.altText: A man and woman sit a bench, looking at paper bills, with a calculator and laptop next to them

items.synopsis: Economists are divided on how well households will weather the storm of rent rises, soaring home loan rates and rising prices, just as Australians are divided in how much financial pressure they're under.

title.children: 'We're in for a massive hit to consumers': How interest rate rises are hurting some more than others

image.altText: A street photograph of protesters carrying signs demanding an end to the Franklin dam plans.

items.synopsis: Activists involved in the protest that saved the Franklin River say the environmental win would not have been possible under today's anti-protest laws.

title.children: Their fight made history, but these environmental activists say their tactics wouldn't work today

image.altText: Artist impression of a pterosaur flying over a beach

items.synopsis: Fossils dated to 107 million years old have been confirmed as the oldest evidence in Australia of the prehistoric flying reptile that some liken to the mythical dragon.

title.children: 100 million years ago, Victoria sat inside the Antarctic Circle — and dragons prowled the icy skies

image.altText: A swarovski bag full of cash and coupons, a pair of Air Jordans, a watch, a bottle of perfume and an apple.

items.synopsis: An ABC examination of the gifts handed to teachers in the past 18 months has found their receipt apparently breaches the enforceable regulation under the Queensland Public Sector Act.

title.children: Some Queensland teachers have been gifted robot vacuums, Air Jordans and concert tickets. Some are asking if it's too much

image.altText: Chris Jordan stares intently while answering a question at Senate Estimates. His brow is furrowed.

items.synopsis: The Australian Taxation Office raised concerns about a confidentiality breach at PwC to Australian Federal Police in March 2018, but a lack of detail meant no investigation was launched.

title.children: Lack of detail stopped federal police initially investigating PwC breach

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Treasury boss Steven Kennedy says he was able to refer PwC to police for investigation thanks to a push by senators to expose the depth of the firm's tax leak scandal.

title.children: 'Clearly disturbing': Treasury referred PwC to police after emails exposed by Senate

image.altText: A person off a stretcher is carried off an RFDS plane on the tarmac

items.synopsis: The Office of Commonwealth Public Prosecution has laid charges against a Kimberley company and master over a serious boat crash that injured dozens of tourists at the Horizontal Falls last year.

title.children: Charges laid against company over WA's Horizontal Falls boat crash that injured dozens of tourists

image.altText: A stern man in a suit walks outside court as a video photographer follows him

items.synopsis: Chris Dawson's former student has given evidence against the 74-year-old convicted murderer, who is facing one count of carnal knowledge, in the NSW District Court.

title.children: Chris Dawson treated student like his 'property' and 'groomed' her, court told

image.altText: Mark McGowan in wet weather gear stands hands on hips smiling at volunteers in fire fighting uniforms.

items.synopsis: Mark McGowan took Labor to unprecedented highs in the state's region, but many of the decisions that define his legacy hit residents hard.

title.children: Loved and loathed, McGowan leaves a complex legacy in WA's regions

image.altText: Major General Angus Campbell accepts a salute during the transition parade at Al Minhad Airbase, United Arab Emirates.

items.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force chief is grilled in parliament over moves to revoke military honours from some soldiers who served in Afghanistan, with one senator suggesting General Angus Campbell should "surrender" his own medal.

title.children: One Nation senator challenges ADF chief to 'surrender' Afghanistan medal

image.altText: A man surrounded by cameras.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court reveals the defamation action of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann against the News Corp media organisation has ended.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann settles defamation action against News Life Media

image.altText: The chinese flag

items.synopsis: Clashes erupt in China's south-western Yunnan province as officials push ahead with plans to raze four minarets and the dome roof of the Najiaying Mosque, angering locals who turn out to confront police.

title.children: Chinese police clash with Muslim ethnic group trying to protect mosque

image.altText: E-scooters with blue helmets on the grass and footpath behind and car park further behind

items.synopsis: A Margaret River councillor questioned whether she ever saw a "single person using a helmet" during a three-month e-scooter trial, with police saying they did not have resources to enforce compliance and safety rules.

title.children: Snubbed helmet rules and underage e-scooter use prompts top Australian holiday town to scrap public trial

image.altText: Tim Tszyu holds up his WBO super-welterweight belt and points to the sky as confetti falls around him.

items.synopsis: Tim Tsyzu's camp insists he will be fit for the first defence of his interim boxing world title despite the fighter requiring surgery after being bitten by a dog.

title.children: Tim Tszyu fight could be postponed after world champion undergoes surgery following dog bite

image.altText: A carpenter uses an axe to cut a wooden beam.

items.synopsis: Carpenters use woodworking techniques pioneered during the building of Notre Dame Cathedral more than 800 years ago to rebuild the world-famous monument's roof.

title.children: Rebuilding Notre Dame's fire-ravaged roof transports workers back to Middle Ages

image.altText: Same-sex marriage supporters celebrate in central Japan.

items.synopsis: A Japanese court rules that not allowing same-sex marriage was unconstitutional, a decision activists welcomed as a step towards marriage equality.

title.children: Pressure on Japan to change marriage laws after court rules same-sex ban is unconstitutional

image.altText: police tape

items.synopsis: NSW Police say the firing of the bullet that broke a classroom window at Macquarie Fields Public School was not a targeted act.

title.children: Bullet breaks Sydney primary school window while children inside

items.synopsis: A daring treetop mission has seen the years-long nesting site of a pair of eastern ospreys rebuilt on the Sunshine Coast after it was badly damaged during storm.

title.children: 'Huge relief' as osprey pair accepts man-made home, perched '25m in the air'

image.altText: A close-up shot of a logo of Crown Resorts on the top of a high-rise building in Perth.

items.synopsis: Crown Resorts and government financial intelligence agency AUSTRAC agree to a $450 million penalty over historical non-compliance with Australia's anti-money laundering laws.

title.children: Crown hit with third-largest fine in Australian corporate history over money laundering breaches

image.altText: A middle-aged to older Japanese man with glasses stands in front of a modern architectural backdrop.

items.synopsis: Photos published by a magazine showed Fumio Kishida's son and his party guests posing on the building's red-carpeted stairs, imitating group photos of newly appointed cabinets.

title.children: Japanese PM forces son to resign after private party at PM's official residence prompts public outrage

image.altText: Family of Brandon Clark sitting around a tree

items.synopsis: Circumstances surrounding death of Brandon Clark, 23, who drowned in the Manning River in Taree during a police pursuit, will be examined during four-day coronial inquest.

title.children: Family of man who drowned during police chase hopes inquest brings change

image.altText: Ethan Ewing, wearing a black wetsuit, holds one hand in the air as he carves through a wave on his surfboard.

items.synopsis: Leading Australian surfer Ethan Ewing receives a death threat as Brazilian fans erupt over judging at the Surf Ranch Pro.

title.children: Australian surfer Ethan Ewing told next event in Brazil will be 'your funeral'

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue shirt looks down at the camera.

items.synopsis: Eileen Cummings recalls physical abuse from missionaries for speaking in her language and a beating with an electric cord, but final compensation and a chance to share her story has finally brought closure to a dark period in Australian history.

title.children: 'Finally, closure': Stolen Generations survivors reach settlement for historic abuse
